alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 3:46PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF JEFFERSON...OSWEGO...AND LEWIS COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 3 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 342 PM EST, the northern edge of the lake effect snow band is just south of Chaumont and Philadelphia across Jefferson County. The southern edge of the band is expanding into Sandy Creek but remains north of Pulaski in Oswego County and north of Lowville in Lewis county. Additional lighter snow is occurring across the rest of the area. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Watertown, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Fort Drum, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, West Carthage, Adams, Dexter, Glen Park, Herrings, Adams Center, Southwick Beach State Park, Henderson Harbor, Barnes Corners, Denmark, New Bremen, Sackets Harbor, Henderson, and Black River. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 37 and 48. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. && TIME...MOT...LOC 2042Z 243DEG 110KT 4406 7574
